conversation.text: Hi, today I'll be teaching you on how to make dough rise faster. Would you like to proceed?
Yes, please.
Perfect! In order to do this recipe you'll need access to microwave-safe cup/glass, a microwave, a bowl of dough and an oven mitt. Do you have these items ready?
Let me check. I don't have an oven mitt.
You can also use a dish towel if you have one of those instead?
That works for me.
So for the first step please fill up one cup of water, it should equate to about 0.24 litres of water.
evidence: Fill a microwave-safe glass with 1 cup (0.24 liters) of water.

conversation.text: Into the microwave-safe cup or the dough?
Into the cup and make sure the cup you use is small enough to fit into the microwave.
evidence: Make sure the glass you use is small enough to fit in your microwave.

conversation.text: No problem! Next step please.
Now put the cup of water into the microwave and put it on the high setting for 2 minutes.
evidence: Microwave the glass of water on high for two minutes.
Microwave the glass of water on high for two minutes.

conversation.text: Sure, I'm done.

Okay, after the two minutes move the cup to one side of the microwave using your dish towel. Make sure you are using the towel because you might burn yourself otherwise. Then place the bowl with the dough in next to the cup in the microwave and shut the door.
evidence: After two minutes, open the microwave and move the glass of water to the side of the microwave to make room for the bowl of dough.
Use an oven mitt or dish towel to move the glass in case it's hot.
Place the dough you’ll be baking in a bowl.
Set the bowl of dough in the microwave and shut the door.

conversation.text: Do I need to cover the bowl with the towel while microwaving?
No, you only need the towel to touch the hot cup. And do not turn on the microwave once you put the bowl inside.
I see.
Are you ready to move onto the next step?
Yes, please.
Okay so leave the bowl and cup together in the microwave but do not turn the microwave on. Leave the dough to rise for 30 to 45 minutes and check that it has risen after 30 minutes.
evidence: Let the dough rise for around 30 to 45 minutes.
Check on the dough after 30 minutes to see if it’s finished.

conversation.text: Sure. Guess we don't need microwave here right? We just want a container for the dough to rise.
We need to leave the bowl with the cup in the microwave because the heat from the hot water will make it warm and moist so that the dough will rise.
That makes sense. What's next?
Okay now check the dough to see if it has risen. You will know if it has risen because it will now be two times bigger. Has it risen enough?
evidence: You’ll know it’s finished rising once it’s doubled in size.

conversation.text: It's much bigger but not as we expected.
Okay if it is not done yet leave it in there for another 15 minutes. Make sure the door is shut after you put it back in so you can keep the moist environment.
evidence: If it's not done rising, leave the dough in the microwave for another 15 minutes.

conversation.text: Thanks for your reminders!
Okay, after 15 more minutes can you check the dough now? Has it fully risen and doubled in size?
evidence: , leave the dough in the microwave for another 15 minutes

conversation.text: Yes, it has!
Okay perfect, we have finished the recipe and have successfully risen the dough! Do you have anymore questions?
That's all! Thank you! This is my first time to prepare the dough from scratch.
That's good, happy I could help!

recipe.title: How to Make Dough Rise Faster

procedure.summary: Fill a microwave-safe glass with 1 cup (0.24 liters) of water.
procedure.description: Make sure the glass you use is small enough to fit in your microwave.

procedure.summary: Microwave the glass of water on high for two minutes.
procedure.description: After two minutes, open the microwave and move the glass of water to the side of the microwave to make room for the bowl of dough. Use an oven mitt or dish towel to move the glass in case it's hot.

procedure.summary: Place the dough you’ll be baking in a bowl.
procedure.description: Use a bowl that’s small enough to fit in your microwave. Don’t worry if the bowl isn’t microwave safe - the microwave won’t be on when it’s in there.

procedure.summary: Set the bowl of dough in the microwave and shut the door.
procedure.description: Leave the glass of water in the microwave with the dough. The glass of water and the heat from the microwave will create a warm, moist environment that will help the dough rise faster. Do not turn on the microwave.

procedure.summary: Let the dough rise for around 30 to 45 minutes.
procedure.description: Check on the dough after 30 minutes to see if it’s finished. You’ll know it’s finished rising once it’s doubled in size. If it's not done rising, leave the dough in the microwave for another 15 minutes.

procedure.summary: Reheat the water if the dough doesn’t rise all the way.
procedure.description: If after 45 minutes the dough still hasn’t doubled in size, remove it from the microwave. Reheat the glass of water on high for two minutes and then place the bowl of dough back in the microwave. Let the dough continue to rise for another 10 to 15 minutes.
